result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel L Pagels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 95 days credit if revoked from probation.

records.addlTxt:
8:32 AM Defendant Samuel L Pagels in court, in custody.  Attorney Aaron Thomas Vruwink in court for Samuel L Pagels.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim ARP appears in court and makes a statement to the court. 
Attorney Knaapen gives the court his sentencing recommendation. Attorney Vruwink gives the court his sentencing recommendation. Defendant reads a letter that he wrote to the court regarding sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No contact w/victim or their residence.  Can have contact w/ARP by telephone and video contact as long as the video contact is recorded.  May go through counseling as long as the counselor is present on the phone as well.

No contact with victims - A.R.P., A.J.P., A.A.P., or their residence(s).
Can have contact w/ ARP by telephone and video contact as long as the video contact is recorded. May go through counseling as long as the counselor is present on the phone as well.

2:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Samuel L Pagels appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Aaron Thomas Vruwink in court for Samuel L Pagels. 
Victim ARP appears in court and gives a statement as to why she wants a modification of the no contact condition. Court will not change the bond conditions at this time. Attorney Vruwink makes a statement regarding the no contact condition. Court modifies the conditions to allowing telephone contact and video contact that is recorded. Parties can go through counseling w/ the counselor on the telephone.
Letter from victim requesting the no contact bond condition be dropped
Bail/bond hearing on August 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:15 AM Defendant Samuel L Pagels appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Aaron Thomas Vruwink in court for Samuel L Pagels. 
Attorney Vruwink is requesting more time on this case. Victim is okay with getting more time on this case.

Fast Forward, Return to Sender
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture
Extradition Expenses

1:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Nathan Oswald in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Samuel L Pagels appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Aaron Thomas Vruwink in court for Samuel L Pagels. 
Not guilty plea. Defendant requests speedy trial. Court advises him that he needs to file speedy trial demand in writing.
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Appearance

2:02 PM Defendant Samuel L Pagels in court.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. Court tells defendant to call the Public Defenders Office to see if he can get Aaron Vruwink appointed on this case. 
Officer Liebe is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being an Officer with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. Testifies to being dispatched to a residence for a report of a disturbance. Testifies to making contact w/ AAP and AJP. Testifies to their statement of what happened. Testifies to not giving consent for the defendant to damage their property. Testifies to them identifying the defendant. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to observing the broken cell phone. Testifies to the parties stating they feared for their safety. Testifies to the defendant staying there for about a year. Testifies to the defendant being out on bond when the incident happened.
Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.
Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
